required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Assessing The Interest of Indocyanine Green Fluorescence Imaging With Radioisotope Method For Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy in Patients With Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative, Prospective, Randomized Study Assessing The Interest of Indocyanine Green Fluorescence Imaging With Radioisotope Method For Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy in Patients With Breast Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

clinical_study.source: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

brief_summary.textblock:
The sentinel node has a fundamental role in the management of early breast cancer.
Currently, the double detection of blue and radioisotope is recommended. A radioactive material requires the presence of a nuclear medicine department and the approval of health authorities. In many centers, this technique is not available. The use of blue is easier to implement technique. However, allergic reactions and prolonged breast tattoo led many teams to stop the practice.
So in common practice, many center use a single method. However, with a single detection, the risk of false negatives and the identification failure rate increased to a significant extent and the number of sentinel lymph node detected and removed is not enough.
Under these conditions, find another method of detection seems crucial. According to the literature, the fluorescence method (ICG) is a technique that seems safe and reliable.
The investigators therefore propose a prospective, randomized study to investigate the interest of fluorescence associated with the isotopic method.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Less Than Two Lymph Nodes Detected
primary_outcome.description: Number of patients with less than two lymph nodes detected by indocyanine (ICG) + isotope versus isotope detection alone

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Lymph Nodes ICG Positive and Tc Positive
secondary_outcome.description: Number of lymph nodes Indocyanine green (ICG) positive and Tc (Technetium)positive

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Lymph Nodes ICG Positive and Tc Negative
secondary_outcome.description: Number of lymph nodes Indocyanine green (ICG) positive and Tc (Technetium) negative

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Lymph Nodes ICG Negative and Tc Positive
secondary_outcome.description: Number of lymph nodes Indocyanine green (ICG) negative and Tc (Technetium) positive

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison Between Groups of the Time of the Surgery
secondary_outcome.description: time from incision to wound closure

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison Between Groups of Anesthesia Time
secondary_outcome.description: time from the injection of anesthesic to the waking

secondary_outcome.measure: Time From Injection of One Dose ICG Injection to Incision Time
secondary_outcome.description: time from injection of one dose ICG injection to incision time

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison Between Groups of Time Surgery Node
secondary_outcome.description: time from incision time to the last node surgery

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With ICG Allergy
secondary_outcome.description: allergy is : redness, edema, itching, larynges edema and/or allergic shock

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With ICG Allergy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 hour after the end of the surgery
secondary_outcome.description: allergy is : redness, edema, itching, larynges edema and/or allergic shock

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With ICG Allergy
secondary_outcome.description: allergy is : redness, edema, itching, larynges edema and/or allergic shock

arm_group.description: intradermal injection of 2.5 milligrams of indocyanine green and 20 MBq of technetium 99 before breast surgery
intradermal injection of 20 MBq of technetium 99 before breast surgery

intervention.description: One injection, 2.5 milligrams per patient, intradermal use
One injection, 20 MBq techntium99, intradermal use

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histologically proved infiltrating breast cancer (ductal, lobular carcinoma…) or a carcinoma in-situ with an elevated risk of micro-invasion. (High grade with necrosis, radiologically evaluated size more than 40mm, or immediate mastectomy…)
- Unifocal or multifocal but in same quarter
- Size < 5cm clinically palpable or not
- Clinically or ultrasound axillary N0
- Isotopic sentinel node detection
- Adult patient
- Signed informed consent by patient or legally responsable authority
- Patient registered to a social security system
- No surgical contra-indication
Exclusion Criteria:
- Mammary carcinoma recurrence
- Previous same side mammary reduction
- Previous lumpectomy
- Contra-indication to surgery
- Pregnant or breast feeding patient
- Denial of participation

overall_official.affiliation: Centre Hospitalier Universitaire de Saint Etienne

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
